description: Number of polynomials of degree n over GF(2) in which the degrees of all irreducible factors are distinct.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
A. Knopfmacher and R. Warlimont, Distinct degree factorizations for polynomials over a finite field, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 347 (1995), no. 6, 2235-2243.
formula: G.f.: prod {m >= 1} (1 + pi(m) x^m), where pi(m) = A001037(m) = number of distinct irreducible polynomials of degree m.
mathematica: max = 31; pi[n_] := Total[ MoebiusMu[n/#] * (2^#/n)& /@ Divisors[n]]; f[x_] := Product[ 1+pi[n]*x^n, {n, 1, max}]; CoefficientList[ Series[ f[x], {x, 0, max}], x] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 24 2011 *)
author: Arnold Knopfmacher [ ARNOLDK(AT)gauss.cam.wits.ac.za ]
